newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 17.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 17.

text.p: -- AT&T Corp said President John Walter resigned, nearly nine months after he became the heir apparent to Chief Executive Officer Robert Allen.
The company said its board voted not to promote Walter to CEO, succeeding Allen.
AT&T also said it expected second quarter results to fall within the range of analysts' estimates. The stock closed at 36-5/16, then fell to 36 in after-hours trading.

-- Apple Computer Inc reported a loss for the latest quarter far lower than Wall Street had expected but said it would not return to profitability later this year, as it had predicted previously. For the fiscal third quarter, Apple had a loss of $56 million, or $0.44 per share, compared with a loss of $32 million, or $0.26 per share, a year earlier. The stock finished at 16-7/16.
-- Microsoft Corp is scheduled to report fourth quarter earnings today. The First Call consensus estimate is $0.79 per share, compared with $0.44 a year ago. The stock closed at 148-7/16.

-- Woolworth Corp is expected to announce it will close more than 400 F.W. Woolworth five-and-dime stores in the U.S. and record an after-tax charge of about $200 million to pay for costs associated with the move, the Wall Street Journal reported. The stock closed at 25-1/16.
